subject: Economics
title: Salt: The Salary in Your Paycheck
description: A micro-lesson that makes Salt: The Salary in Your Paycheck usable.

hook.text: The word 'salary' comes from the Latin 'salarium' â€” payment in salt. Roman soldiers were partly paid in salt.

buildup.text: Salt preserved food before refrigeration. In a world where meat rotted in days, salt was survival itself.

discovery.text: Salt was so valuable that trade routes like the Saharan salt roads shaped entire civilizations.

twist.text: When industrial production made salt cheap in the 1800s, its monetary role vanished overnight.

climax.text: Commodity money only works when the commodity stays scarce. Technology can destroy any currency.

punchline.text: Your salary is named after a condiment.

quiz.question: Why did salt work as money in the ancient world?
options: It was rare and essential for food preservation
